page.title: 11Oldland Motor Services
page.content: This is a small privately owned garage. Its income is mostly derived from the servicing and repair of motor vehicles. A small percentage of income comes from the sale of self-service petrol. The customers pay in small office, where sweets and cigarettes are sold to supplement the income. The weekly delivery of petrol costs Â£9000. There are four petrol pumps, one diesel and one parafin pump on the forecourt. The repair side of the business is thriving but the garage propietor considers that the days of rural petrol stations are drawing to a close. The mechanics are engaged on a self employed basis. 90% of the customers live locally as the garage is not on a main through route. The present owner has been there for 13 years.
